001package org.biopax.validator;
002
003import org.biopax.paxtools.controller.PropertyEditor;
004import org.biopax.paxtools.model.BioPAXElement;
005import org.biopax.validator.api.CvRestriction;
006import org.biopax.validator.api.CvRule;
007import org.biopax.validator.api.CvUtils;
008import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
009
010import javax.annotation.PostConstruct;
011import java.util.HashSet;
012import java.util.Set;
013
014/**
015 * An abstract class for CV terms checks.
016 *
017 * @param <D> property domain
018 * @author rodche
019 */
020public abstract class AbstractCvRule<D extends BioPAXElement> extends AbstractRule<D> implements CvRule<D> {
021
022  @Autowired
023  protected CvUtils ontologyUtils;
024
025  protected final Class<D> domain;
026  protected final String property; // helps validate generic ControlledVocabulary instances
027  protected final Set<CvRestriction> restrictions;
028  private Set<String> validTerms;
029  protected PropertyEditor<? super D, ?> editor;
030
031  /**
032   * Constructor.
033   *
034   * @param domain       a BioPAX class for which the CV terms restrictions apply
035   * @param property     the name of the BioPAX property to get controlled vocabularies or null
036   * @param restrictions a list of beans, each defining names (a subtree of an ontology) that
037   *                     is either to include or exclude (when 'not' flag is set) from the valid names set.
038   */
039  public AbstractCvRule(Class<D> domain, String property, CvRestriction... restrictions) {
040    this.domain = domain;
041    this.property = property;
042    this.restrictions = new HashSet<>(restrictions.length);
043    for (CvRestriction c : restrictions) {
044      this.restrictions.add(c);
045    }
046  }
047
048  @PostConstruct
049  public void init() {
050    if (ontologyUtils != null) {
051      setValidTerms(ontologyUtils.getValidTermNames(this));
052    } else {
053      throw new IllegalStateException("ontologyUtils is NULL!");
054    }
055  }
056
057  public boolean canCheck(Object thing) {
058    return domain.isInstance(thing);
059  }
060
061  /* (non-Javadoc)
062   * @see org.biopax.validator.impl.CvRule#getValidTerms()
063   */
064  public Set<String> getValidTerms() {
065    return validTerms;
066  }
067
068  /* (non-Javadoc)
069   * @see org.biopax.validator.impl.CvRule#setValidTerms(java.util.Set)
070   */
071  public void setValidTerms(Set<String> validTerms) {
072    this.validTerms = validTerms;
073  }
074
075  // for unit testing
076
077  /* (non-Javadoc)
078   * @see org.biopax.validator.impl.CvRule#getRestrictions()
079   */
080  public Set<CvRestriction> getRestrictions() {
081    return restrictions;
082  }
083
084  /* (non-Javadoc)
085   * @see org.biopax.validator.impl.CvRule#getDomain()
086   */
087  public Class<D> getDomain() {
088    return domain;
089  }
090
091  /* (non-Javadoc)
092   * @see org.biopax.validator.impl.CvRule#getProperty()
093   */
094  public String getProperty() {
095    return property;
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Gets the internal BiopaxOntologyManager instance
100   *
101   * @return ontology manager
102   */
103  public CvUtils getBiopaxOntologyManager() {
104    return ontologyUtils;
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Gets the corresponding CV property editor.
109   * Returns null if either the 'domain' itself is of CV type
110   * or the 'property' is null.
111   *
112   * @return biopax property editor
113   */
114  public PropertyEditor<? super D, ?> getEditor() {
115    return editor;
116  }
117
118  /**
119   * OntologyAccess IDs used to check this CV rule.
120   * These can be extracted from the CV restrictions
121   * used to define the rule.
122   * (other ontologies are not used).
123   *
124   * @return ontology IDs, such as e.g. 'MI', 'GO'
125   */
126  protected Set<String> getOntologyIDs() {
127    Set<String> ids = new HashSet<>();
128    for (CvRestriction restriction : restrictions)
129      ids.add(restriction.getOntologyId());
130    return ids;
131  }
132
133}
